job_title: Director of Operations in Waterloo, ON
pros: Sonoma county is a beautiful place to work
cons: Healthcare has been incredibly stressful since COVID

pros: Room to grow internally, supportive leaders, and great work life balance
cons: Unfortunately, there are not many remote positions. BUT onsite location is comfortable with tea, coffee, and lots of work space.

pros:
- Great management: The nursing manager really takes time to listen and actually makes changes.
- Great team: All the nurses are super nice
- Most providers are very nice and easy to work with. The medical assistants are helpful and kind.
- Good work/ life balance: You only work 4 days a week
- You get to help the underserved and work within the community during the fires and pandemic.
- Excellent place to learn if you’re a new grad
cons:
- The pay could be more competitive 
- High staff turn over rate due to pay rate, people get their experience and leave
I don't have any cons to share

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Petaluma, CA
pros: It is a great environment and team
cons: Not a competitive salary considering the cost of living

job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in Petaluma, CA
pros: From the start of applying it was super easy and understanding on how to be apart of the team. They never failed to teach me when i had billions of questions. They are quick and easy and always find a way to resolve a problem. they always make sure that you are okay whether it be a work problem, health problem, or emotional problem. you could always count on them for help. not only that they always make sure the Patient gets what they need. They are super organized and always on top of things. The learning process is smooth.
cons: I've never had any complaints about working here.  nor CONS

pros: Great benefits, rapid growth, great employees, and innovative thinking. Management is intelligent, creative, honest, and I like the little perks that are given throughout the year.
cons: I cannot think of anything that is challenging at this time.  The company works very hard to continuously improve, create new programs and help the community.

job_title: Sterile Processing Technician in Petaluma, CA
pros: Most days its very fast paced as a sterile tech. You're on your feet and always have something to do so you're never bored. All the dental assistants are super nice and easy going and will always help or answer any questions you have. Feels like a family here, and has great benefits as well through the company.

Petaluma Health Center Dental is a great place to work! Everyone I've had the chance to work with have become part of my life. It has given me the opportunity to grow and expand my knowledge. With dedication and ambition I was able to advance in new positions.  Overall I would highly recommend working for Petaluma Health center!

review_title: Experience should be promoted and not race
pros: This could be a great place to work for, but many changes need to take place STAT!!!
cons: If you are a horrible employee and should be fired, this company will actually promote you!!!   If you're lazy and a back stabber, apply at PHC.

review_title: Ok job, good place to get experience
pros:
Good place to get experience.
Company cares about their patients.
On the job training. 
Some good team leaders.
Busy clinic- days go by fast. 
One of the best FQHCs in the country and state.
cons:
Gap in communication with management.
Anti-nurse mentality. 
Run by medical assistants. 
Extremely high turnover rate. 
Some poor team leaders. 
Workplace harassment.

pros: Patient centered, innovative, and team based approach to Health Services Delivery.
cons: Sorry, can't find a con today.... it's Friday. :)

pros: The CEO really cares about employee well-being. Great co-workers, great vision and mission and values.
cons: Not for profit means not the most money compared to for-profit companies. But the work environment and people here are more important than money can ever buy.

job_title: Sterile Processing Tech in Petaluma, CA
pros: Great benefits. It feels like a family working with the dental assistants, Even without any dental background, they teach you everything that you need to know. Great place to work and they have great career opportunities!
